name: TheAtlantic
text: Books about Ruth Bader Ginsburg, Clarence Thomas, John Roberts, and others reveal the personalities behind judicial decisions. More from @cray_kate in this week's #TheAtlanticBooksBriefing: https://t.co/vRvelQiBre

name: TheAtlantic
text: "It is easy to see why Trump appointees who work in institutions that deal with science and public health might be the first to break: Their jobs require them to grapple every day with data that they have to deny," @anneapplebaum writes: https://t.co/VeksFKk6jy

name: TheAtlantic
text: Experts have long feared that the virus will peak again in winter. How bad could the next few months get? @jameshamblin and @alexismadrigal answer cold-month questions on the podcast Social Distance: https://t.co/1qV5NdE3yK

name: TheAtlantic
text: "I felt protected on this side of the country, grounded within the boundaries of water and range. I never thought I'd leave the West Coast again," @FrisbieKarleigh writes: https://t.co/wOlSDq4EaH
